intro: Hermannia chrysanthemifolia, commonly known as the golden-eyed hermannia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its most distinctive feature is its clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that resemble chrysanthemums, giving it its common name. Hermannia chrysanthemifolia thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
